title: RoW 1993 Porsche 911 Turbo 3.6
description: This 1993 Porsche 911 Turbo 3.6 is a Belgian-market example that shows 176k kilometers (~109k miles), and it is finished in Black Metallic over a Carrera Grey special leather interior. The car is powered by a turbocharged 3.6-liter flat-six paired with a five-speed manual transaxle, and equipment includes 18" Speedline wheels, a power sunroof, a fixed rear spoiler, front sport seats, air conditioning, a remote six-disc CD changer, and Porsche Classic Communication Management (PCCM) Infotainment with navigation. This Belgian-Market 964 Turbo 3.6 was purchased by its current owner, a licensed German retail dealership, in 2024 and is now offered on their behalf in Göttingen, Germany, with the owner's manual, a stamped service booklet, service records, and Dutch registration.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a RoW 1993 Porsche 911 Turbo 3.6 at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #179,968.
text: This 1993 Porsche 911 Turbo 3.6 is a Belgian-market example that shows 176k kilometers (~109k miles), and it is finished in Black Metallic over a Carrera Grey special leather interior. The car is powered by a turbocharged 3.6-liter flat-six paired with a five-speed manual transaxle, and equipment includes 18″ Speedline wheels, a power sunroof, a fixed rear spoiler, front sport seats, air conditioning, a remote six-disc CD changer, and Porsche Classic Communication Management (PCCM) Infotainment with navigation. This Belgian-Market 964 Turbo 3.6 was purchased by its current owner, a licensed German retail dealership, in 2024 and is now offered on their behalf in Göttingen, Germany, with the owner’s manual, a stamped service booklet, service records, and Dutch registration. The 964 Turbo featured widened bodywork compared to the contemporary 911 and was fitted with aerodynamic side mirrors and a fixed rear spoiler. The 3.6-powered variant was introduced in January 1993, and a reported 754 examples were produced for the model year. This example is finished in Black Metallic (L744). The multi-piece 18″ Speedline wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport tires that show date codes from 2019 and 2020. The Turbo features uprated brakes compared to the standard 964, including larger calipers and cross-drilled rotors at each corner. A Porsche-branded strut tower brace has been installed. The front sport seats are trimmed in Carrera Grey special leather, which extends to the dashboard, center console, and door panels. Additional features include an onboard computer, air conditioning, power windows, a remote six-disc CD changer, and Porsche Classic Communication Management (PCCM) Infotainment with navigation. The four-spoke steering wheel has a leather-upholstered airbag module and frames a central tachometer with a 6,600-rpm redline as well as a 320-km/h speedometer and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, oil level, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 176k kilometers (~109k miles). The turbocharged 3.6-liter flat-six was factory-rated at 355 horsepower and 384 lb-ft of torque. It sends power to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transaxle. Decoding the option sticker reveals the following information: L744 – Black Metallic paint MB – Carrera Grey special leather upholstery C22 – Version for Belgium X26 – Leather covered steering wheel airbag 383 – Sports seat, left, electrical height adjustment 387 – Sports seat, right, electrical height adjustment 567 – Tinted windscreen 650 – Sunroof 692 – Alpine-Porsche CDC-1 CD changer The seller, a BaT Local Partner, offers shipping, importation, and titling support at an additional cost. Please inquire directly with the seller with questions about these services. The vehicle is being sold on its German registration, which serves as an ownership document in Germany. html:
This 1993 Porsche 911 Turbo 3.6 is a Belgian-market example that shows 176k kilometers (~109k miles), and it is finished in Black Metallic over a Carrera Grey special leather interior. The car is powered by a turbocharged 3.6-liter flat-six paired with a five-speed manual transaxle, and equipment includes 18″ Speedline wheels, a power sunroof, a fixed rear spoiler, front sport seats, air conditioning, a remote six-disc CD changer, and Porsche Classic Communication Management (PCCM) Infotainment with navigation. This Belgian-Market 964 Turbo 3.6 was purchased by its current owner, a licensed German retail dealership, in 2024 and is now offered on their behalf in Göttingen, Germany, with the owner’s manual, a stamped service booklet, service records, and Dutch registration.

The 964 Turbo featured widened bodywork compared to the contemporary 911 and was fitted with aerodynamic side mirrors and a fixed rear spoiler. The 3.6-powered variant was introduced in January 1993, and a reported 754 examples were produced for the model year. This example is finished in Black Metallic (L744).

The multi-piece 18″ Speedline wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport tires that show date codes from 2019 and 2020. The Turbo features uprated brakes compared to the standard 964, including larger calipers and cross-drilled rotors at each corner. A Porsche-branded strut tower brace has been installed.

The front sport seats are trimmed in Carrera Grey special leather, which extends to the dashboard, center console, and door panels. Additional features include an onboard computer, air conditioning, power windows, a remote six-disc CD changer, and Porsche Classic Communication Management (PCCM) Infotainment with navigation.

The four-spoke steering wheel has a leather-upholstered airbag module and frames a central tachometer with a 6,600-rpm redline as well as a 320-km/h speedometer and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, oil level, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 176k kilometers (~109k miles).

The turbocharged 3.6-liter flat-six was factory-rated at 355 horsepower and 384 lb-ft of torque.

It sends power to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transaxle.

Decoding the option sticker reveals the following information:

  • L744 – Black Metallic paint
  • MB – Carrera Grey special leather upholstery
  • C22 – Version for Belgium
  • X26 – Leather covered steering wheel airbag
  • 383 – Sports seat, left, electrical height adjustment
  • 387 – Sports seat, right, electrical height adjustment
  • 567 – Tinted windscreen
  • 650 – Sunroof
  • 692 – Alpine-Porsche CDC-1 CD changer

The seller, a BaT Local Partner, offers shipping, importation, and titling support at an additional cost. Please inquire directly with the seller with questions about these services. The vehicle is being sold on its German registration, which serves as an ownership document in Germany.
